<a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/478913368;283558022;t" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Fidelity " style="width:100%;max-width: 167px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="167" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby80NDEvMTYwMjg3MDE5MS1maWRlbGl0eS1sb2dvMy5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good morning. </strong>We were so sad to hear that <em>Jeopardy!</em> host Alex Trebek died yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Alex was an inspiration to us. Not only was he able to make learning cool, he did so in a way that brought people closer together. <em>Jeopardy!</em> memories are family memories. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ll miss you, Alex. And thanks for teaching us that sometimes, the questions are more important than the answers.</p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
POLICY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/09/businesses-look-towards-future-biden?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Business World’s Wish List for Joe Biden
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Santa making a long list and checking it twice, then waving " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=377 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xUNd9ZaY6wdUH2ZiGQ/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Santa making a long list and checking it twice, then waving " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/xUNd9ZaY6wdUH2ZiGQ/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Now that Joe Biden won the presidential election, business leaders are asking the important questions about the upcoming regime change in D.C.: What’s in it for me? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are the six things biz leaders want from Biden.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">1. Peaceful transfer of power:</strong> Nothing makes execs antsy quite like a sitting president resisting a central component of the democratic process, so a smooth transition is <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/44f738e8-eb6f-4394-b833-6b3207ce31bf?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">priority numero uno</a> for biz leaders; JPMorgan’s CEO Jamie Dimon urged President Trump to “honor the decision of the voters and support a peaceful transition of power,” while billionaire investor Bill Ackman called on the president to “concede graciously.” Trump has not yet conceded.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">2. Stomp out the coronavirus:</strong> The pandemic sent a shockwave across the global economy this spring, and while conditions are slowly picking up, many businesses remain in a deep hole. Biden’s <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/07/biden-pandemic-response-434701?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said</a> he can’t end the pandemic by “flipping a switch,” but biz leaders hope a more hands-on approach compared to President Trump’s can lead to a quicker economic recovery. Biden is expected to announce his coronavirus task force today.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">3. Improve trade relations:</strong> During his tenure as president, President Trump launched a trade war with China and got into bitter scuffles with longstanding economic partners like the EU. Biz leaders, who generally oppose trade barriers like tariffs because they mess with supply chains and raise prices, hope Biden will restore <a href="https://www.bbc.com/news/business-54712193?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">friendlier</a> trade relations with other countries.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">4. Boringness:</strong> Whereas President Trump’s policies fostered a mostly favorable corporate environment, it came with a <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/06/business/wall-street-joe-biden-president-trump/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">lot of baggage</a>. "Investors spent the last four years one tweet away from major market moves," Ed Mills, Washington policy analyst at Raymond James, told CNN. Corporate America is looking for more predictability under Biden. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">5. Access to high-skilled workers:</strong> Silicon Valley leaders will be hoping for a reversal of President Trump’s restrictions on H-1B visas, which tech companies use to bring in talented workers from abroad. Biden plans to <a href="https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/nri/visa-and-immigration/joe-biden-plans-to-increase-h-1b-visa-limit-and-remove-country-quota-for-green-cards/articleshow/79108357.cms?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">increase the number</a> of high-skilled visas.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">6. No tax hike:</strong> Biden has pledged to <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/for-business-biden-bodes-a-less-hospitable-but-more-predictable-presidency-11604771135?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raise the corporate tax rate</a>, which businesses no-likey. Their only hope is a Republican controlled Senate blocking Biden’s tax agenda. </p>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ELECTION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/09/election-aftermath-else-need-know?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Election Aftermath: What Else You Need to Know
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Let’s keep the election coverage rolling with some more highlights from the weekend. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The cabinet: </strong>The level of<strong style="color:#000"> </strong>speculation over who Biden will tap for his cabinet posts rivals NBA free agency, and the Treasury could be the first and nastiest fight. Politico pegs Federal Reserve Governor Lael Brainard as the <a href="https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/07/joe-biden-cabinet-picks-possible-choices-433431?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">early frontrunner</a> because she’s fairly uncontroversial. Other contenders include Sen. Elizabeth Warren and Co-CEO of Ariel Investments Mellody Hobson. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Day 1: </strong><a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/biden-first-executive-orders-measures/2020/11/07/9fb9c1d0-210b-11eb-b532-05c751cd5dc2_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Here</a> are a <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-07/biden-s-first-day-plans-range-from-covid-to-climate-guns-labor?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">few</a> <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/08/us/politics/biden-trump-executive-action.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stories</a> <a href="https://qz.com/1928560/bidens-day-one-agenda/?utm_source=email&utm_medium=daily-brief&utm_content=10145735&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">explaining</a> what Biden’s promised to do on his first day in office. Expect an avalanche of executive orders.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Geopolitics: </strong>Foreign leaders <a href="https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-global-trade-paris-b51640fac85b6cf13bd4d793bbcff625?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted their congratulations</a> to Joe Biden from all the time zones yesterday. Allies like Germany hope Biden will restore once-cozy ties, while rivals like Iran will be both a) relieved that the hawkish Trump administration is out the door and b) wary of how they’ll be treated by a President Biden. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Photo galleries: </strong>Check out pics from a <a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/pictureshow/2020/11/08/932646868/photos-after-2020-election-a-nation-divided-reacts?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">wild Saturday</a> around the country. And here’s how newspapers all over the world <a href="https://www.axios.com/newspapers-spotlight-biden-victory-daaef896-4f0e-43fa-bf3e-d2d3513eb380.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported the news</a>.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
EDUCATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/08/flotus-dr-jill-biden-will-champion-educators?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Office Hours Are Open
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="CLEVELAND, OHIO - SEPTEMBER 30:   Dr. Jill Biden, wife of Democratic U.S..." style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMDU2L2RlbW9jcmF0aWNfcHJlc2lkZW50aWFsX24uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Alex Wong/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Even after Joe Biden’s wife, Dr. Jill Biden, moves into the White House, she plans to <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/in-depth/entertainment/celebrities/2020/11/07/jill-biden-historic-first-lady-call-her-professor-flotus/6042142002/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">keep her current job</a> as an English professor at Northern Virginia Community College. In doing so, she’d become the first FLOTUS in the position’s 231-year history to have a full-time job outside of her duties as First Lady.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Biden received a doctorate in education from the University of Delaware, and considers herself a “lifelong educator.” </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That means education is going to be at the top of her agenda. She <a href="https://www.cbsnews.com/news/jill-biden-first-lady-joe-teaching/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told CBS</a> she’d advocate for free community college tuition, more support for military families, and funding for cancer research. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>By working while FLOTUS-ing, “I want people to value teachers and know their contributions, and lift up the profession," Biden said. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">We should also mention Doug </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Doug Emhoff, to be specific—VP-elect Kamala Harris’s husband. He’ll be the first male spouse of any vice president or president. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">10-second bio: </strong>Emhoff is an entertainment lawyer who once defended an ad agency in a <a href="https://www.businessinsider.com/doug-emhoff-kamala-harriss-husband-taco-bell-chihuahua-case-2020-8?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">$42 million legal battle</a> over the Taco Bell chihuahua.</p>

<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Trying to understand investing today can feel a bit like climbing Mt. Everest—without a Sherpa. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So we teamed up with our friends at <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/479035251;283780279;r" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fidelity</a> to help guide us—and other young investors out there—on everything from investing trends to economic shifts to the pandemic’s effect on the market. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Introducing, <a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/479035251;283780279;r" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Fresh Invest: What to Know When Investing Today</a>—a limited podcast series hosted by our very own Alex Lieberman, CEO of Morning Brew (you know, the media company behind this here newsletter).  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Each week, Alex and a guest from Fidelity will dig into an <em>oh so fresh </em>topic as it relates to investing today, and answer some of the biggest questions on the minds of young investors. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/479035251;283780279;r" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">In our latest episode</a>, Alex and John Gagliardi, a regional brokerage consultant for Fidelity, discuss what gold means as a unique asset class and why we should all be giving it our attention.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Everything from gold's position in the economy to the various ways people can invest in it will be examined in a discussion that is sure to be solid gold.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><a href="https://ad.doubleclick.net/ddm/clk/479035251;283780279;r" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tune in right here</a>.</p>

FINANCE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/11/08/ants-ipo-got-squashed?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Why Ant’s IPO Got Squashed
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Overshadowed by, you know, everything last week was the <a href="https://www.scmp.com/business/banking-finance/article/3108795/explainer-how-avalanche-rules-buries-ant-groups-us395?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">stunning collapse</a> of Ant Group’s IPO. What exactly happened?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Ant Group, a fintech leader and affiliate of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba, was set to go public in Hong Kong and Shanghai as the world’s largest IPO.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With a valuation of $359 billion, it would’ve had a bigger market cap than the largest U.S. bank, JPMorgan. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Jack Ma decided to speak up. In an eyebrow-raising speech last month, the legendary Alibaba cofounder blasted Chinese financial regulators...in front of financial regulators. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Days before the IPO, Ma was <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-05/inside-the-chaotic-unraveling-of-jack-ma-s-35-billion-ant-ipo?srnd=premium&sref=KkPzpZvz&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">summoned to Beijing</a> by officials and was told (not-so-politely) to expect some trouble. Then, the IPO was pulled under murky circumstances as the government handed down more restrictions on microlending.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Why it matters: </strong>Ma’s comments reflected the <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/06/technology/china-ant-group-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tense relationship</a> between China’s growing fintech sector and the traditional financial system. Some experts speculate that the Chinese government wanted to use Ant to show that, just like LeBron doesn’t get every foul call, no private company is more powerful than the state.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Start Talking: Carbon Pricing
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Every Monday, we curate a handful of balanced resources about a hot-button business issue and encourage you to discuss with friends, family, or coworkers. Well, maybe not at Coinbase. </em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">President-elect Joe Biden is expected to take aggressive action to combat climate change, and one thing he’ll need to decide on is carbon pricing, a method of cutting emissions using instruments like carbon taxes or cap-and-trade systems. Let's take the temperature of the debate. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A simple overview of carbon pricing. (</span><span><a href="https://unfccc.int/about-us/regional-collaboration-centres/the-ci-aca-initiative/about-carbon-pricing#eq-2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">UN</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Go a little deeper on how it works...or doesn’t. (</span><span><a href="https://www.vox.com/energy-and-environment/2018/7/20/17584376/carbon-tax-congress-republicans-cost-economy?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Vox</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The IMF thinks a carbon tax is the “single most powerful” tool for fighting climate change. (</span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/10/10/carbon-tax-most-powerful-way-to-combat-climate-change-imf.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CNBC</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>But, in recent years, a growing contingent of politicians have tried leaving it behind. (</span><span><a href="https://www.wbur.org/cognoscenti/2020/08/03/carbon-pricing-tax-climate-change-policy-frederick-hewett?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WBUR</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Why Joe Biden’s climate agenda may not include a carbon tax. (</span><span><a href="https://www.axios.com/joe-biden-carbon-tax-climate-change-plan-e8d522a8-5015-45fc-8164-3ec5c8a0d8a3.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Axios</a></span><span>)</span>
</li>
</ul>
</td>
</tr>

Biden\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003c!--[if mso]\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Santa making a long list and checking it twice, src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/xUNd9ZaY6wdUH2ZiGQ/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNow that Joe Biden won the presidential election, business leaders are asking the important questions about the upcoming regime change in D.C.: What’s in it for me? \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHere are the six things biz leaders want from Biden.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e1. Peaceful transfer of power:\u003c/strong\u003e Nothing makes execs antsy quite like a sitting president resisting a central component of the democratic process, so a smooth transition is \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/44f738e8-eb6f-4394-b833-6b3207ce31bf?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epriority numero uno\u003c/a\u003e for biz leaders; JPMorgan’s CEO Jamie Dimon urged President Trump to “honor the decision of the voters and support a peaceful transition of power,” while billionaire investor Bill Ackman called on the president to “concede graciously.” Trump has not yet conceded.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e2. Stomp out the coronavirus:\u003c/strong\u003e The pandemic sent a shockwave across the global economy this spring, and while conditions are slowly picking up, many businesses remain in a deep hole. Biden’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/07/biden-pandemic-response-434701?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid\u003c/a\u003e he can’t end the pandemic by “flipping a switch,” but biz leaders hope a more hands-on approach compared to President Trump’s can lead to a quicker economic recovery. Biden is expected to announce his coronavirus task force today.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e3. Improve trade relations:\u003c/strong\u003e During his tenure as president, President Trump launched a trade war with China and got into bitter scuffles with longstanding economic partners like the EU. Biz leaders, who generally oppose trade barriers like tariffs because they mess with supply chains and raise prices, hope Biden will restore \u003ca href=\"https://www.bbc.com/news/business-54712193?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efriendlier\u003c/a\u003e trade relations with other countries.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e4. Boringness:\u003c/strong\u003e Whereas President Trump’s policies fostered a mostly favorable corporate environment, it came with a \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2020/11/06/business/wall-street-joe-biden-president-trump/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elot of baggage\u003c/a\u003e. \"Investors spent the last four years one tweet away from major market moves,\" Ed Mills, Washington policy analyst at Raymond James, told CNN. Corporate America is looking for more predictability under Biden. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e5. Access to high-skilled workers:\u003c/strong\u003e Silicon Valley leaders will be hoping for a reversal of President Trump’s restrictions on H-1B visas, which tech companies use to bring in talented workers from abroad. Biden plans to \u003ca href=\"https://economictimes.indiatimes.com/nri/visa-and-immigration/joe-biden-plans-to-increase-h-1b-visa-limit-and-remove-country-quota-for-green-cards/articleshow/79108357.cms?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eincrease the number\u003c/a\u003e of high-skilled visas.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e6. No tax hike:\u003c/strong\u003e Biden has pledged to \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/for-business-biden-bodes-a-less-hospitable-but-more-predictable-presidency-11604771135?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraise the corporate tax rate\u003c/a\u003e, which businesses no-likey. Their only hope is a Republican controlled Senate blocking Biden’s tax agenda. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLet’s keep the election coverage rolling with some more highlights from the weekend. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe cabinet: \u003c/strong\u003eThe level of\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003e \u003c/strong\u003especulation over who Biden will tap for his cabinet posts rivals NBA free agency, and the Treasury could be the first and nastiest fight. Politico pegs Federal Reserve Governor Lael Brainard as the \u003ca href=\"https://www.politico.com/news/2020/11/07/joe-biden-cabinet-picks-possible-choices-433431?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eearly frontrunner\u003c/a\u003e because she’s fairly uncontroversial. Other contenders include Sen. Elizabeth Warren and Co-CEO of Ariel Investments Mellody Hobson. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eDay 1: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/politics/biden-first-executive-orders-measures/2020/11/07/9fb9c1d0-210b-11eb-b532-05c751cd5dc2_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eHere\u003c/a\u003e are a \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-07/biden-s-first-day-plans-range-from-covid-to-climate-guns-labor?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efew\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/08/us/politics/biden-trump-executive-action.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estories\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://qz.com/1928560/bidens-day-one-agenda/?utm_source=email\u0026utm_medium=daily-brief\u0026utm_content=10145735\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eexplaining\u003c/a\u003e what Biden’s promised to do on his first day in office. Expect an avalanche of executive orders.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGeopolitics: \u003c/strong\u003eForeign leaders \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/article/election-2020-joe-biden-donald-trump-global-trade-paris-b51640fac85b6cf13bd4d793bbcff625?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted their congratulations\u003c/a\u003e to Joe Biden from all the time zones yesterday. Allies like Germany hope Biden will restore once-cozy ties, while rivals like Iran will be both a) relieved that the hawkish Trump administration is out the door and b) wary of how they’ll be treated by a President Biden. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePhoto galleries: \u003c/strong\u003eCheck out pics from a \u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/pictureshow/2020/11/08/932646868/photos-after-2020-election-a-nation-divided-reacts?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ewild Saturday\u003c/a\u003e around the country. What exactly happened?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eAnt Group, a fintech leader and affiliate of Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba, was set to go public in Hong Kong and Shanghai as the world’s largest IPO.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith a valuation of $359 billion, it would’ve had a bigger market cap than the largest U.S. bank, JPMorgan. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Jack Ma decided to speak up. In an eyebrow-raising speech last month, the legendary Alibaba cofounder blasted Chinese financial regulators...in front of financial regulators. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDays before the IPO, Ma was \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-11-05/inside-the-chaotic-unraveling-of-jack-ma-s-35-billion-ant-ipo?srnd=premium\u0026sref=KkPzpZvz\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esummoned to Beijing\u003c/a\u003e by officials and was told (not-so-politely) to expect some trouble. Then, the IPO was pulled under murky circumstances as the government handed down more restrictions on microlending.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhy it matters: \u003c/strong\u003eMa’s comments reflected the \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/11/06/technology/china-ant-group-ipo.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etense relationship\u003c/a\u003e between China’s growing fintech sector and the traditional financial system. Some experts speculate that the Chinese government wanted to use Ant to show that, just like LeBron doesn’t get every foul call, no private company is more powerful than the state.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F11%2F08%2Fants-ipo-got-squashed\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block;
